3565a5e80d87bace.name: AdvancedSearch
3565a5e80d87bace.doc:
V13 Advanced Searching (repo intelligence layer):
- index: build file catalog + pointer registry (symbols with locations)
- locate: query over pointers/files with facets + scoring
- facets: summarize index distribution
- hints: suggest next queries (symbol/path fuzzy)
- pointer: resolve pointer id -> location + snippet

753d48a19ae30ca8.name: index
753d48a19ae30ca8.doc:
Build/update the pointer registry incrementally.

Speed model:
  - Reuse existing per-file facets + pointers when (mtime,size) unchanged.
  - Only re-parse changed/new files.

Output: `.vibe/index/v13_search.json`

00baa32bdf6a67dc.name: locate
00baa32bdf6a67dc.doc:
Query DSL (space-separated):
  - kind:function|class|export|symbol
  - ext:.py|.ts|...
  - path:core/orchestrator
  - symbol:Orchestrator
  - import:requests
  - free tokens => fuzzy match over symbol name + path
Returns best matches across pointer registry first; falls back to file paths.

a32c47f361bb5b13.name: AdvancedRAG
a32c47f361bb5b13.doc:
V13 Advanced RAG (offline-first).

Contract:
  - No hidden web fetch.
  - Ingest accepts either raw `content` or a local `path`.
  - Query returns the top-ranked chunks with an explicit evidence level.

aba61ae71b7ea332.name: ingest
aba61ae71b7ea332.doc:
Ingest knowledge sources.

Each source may include:
  - source: string (url/id)
  - type: string
  - content: string (preferred)
  - path: local file path (optional)
  - meta: dict (optional)

cb2c774b0d6b4385.name: query
cb2c774b0d6b4385.doc:
Retrieve top chunks from the ingested KB.

Evidence level:
  - E0 if KB is empty
  - E1 if user-provided content exists (this KB)

a3c0ce5bba817bdc.name: StackPlugin
a3c0ce5bba817bdc.doc:
Stack plugin interface (enterprise v11.1).

We pass repo_root into suggested_gates so plugins can inspect package manager + scripts safely.

cfacf11706a15bf8.name: Finding
cfacf11706a15bf8.doc:
Canonical, tool-agnostic finding schema (v11).

Notes:
  - `confidence` is 0..100.
  - `severity` is one of: critical|high|medium|low|info
  - `category` uses Vibe taxonomy (security, bug, performance, style, docs, architecture, dependency, test)

5331ff879b95bd9a.name: git_changed_files
5331ff879b95bd9a.doc:
Return changed files (name-only) vs base.

Uses `git diff --name-only <base>...HEAD` when possible.

If git isn't available or repo isn't git, returns []

3dbf3657676b0f31.name: add
3dbf3657676b0f31.signature: add(self, *, id, category, severity, title, description, recommendation, confidence, lineno, end_lineno, tags, cwe)

ecdf956f4532c6ff.name: load_config
ecdf956f4532c6ff.doc: Load `vibe.config.yml` if present, else return defaults.

75e3df3bcafc48f5.name: _load_rulemap
75e3df3bcafc48f5.doc:
Load mapping from rule_id patterns to skill_ids.
Patterns can be exact or use '*' wildcard suffix.

d044b2635e580ca9.name: build_triggers
d044b2635e580ca9.doc:
Build a compact trigger set used by the router.
Triggers are intentionally string-based so they can be stable + debuggable.

0fd3d69fb1721a5c.name: _load_automap
0fd3d69fb1721a5c.doc:
Automap is generated by the pack (or `vibe skills-reindex`).
If missing, router falls back to filename heuristics.

f11767cfbbb871d5.name: route_skills
f11767cfbbb871d5.signature: route_skills(repo_root, *, stacks, findings, gates, task, enforce_lock, max_selected)
f11767cfbbb871d5.doc:
Explainable, automation-first routing.
- Every skill in the repo gets an automap entry so it can be selected automatically.
- External skills are excluded if enforce_lock=True and unpinned.
- Registry/awesome-list skills are only auto-selected in discovery mode.
- De-dup: do not select multiple skills from the same repo/group_id.

224476bb5402c649.name: select_cruel_files
224476bb5402c649.doc: Select a stable subset of files for Cruel analysis to keep runtime predictable.

fcbfe4918d0032de.name: run_cruel
fcbfe4918d0032de.doc: Run CruelSystem against selected files and return a compact report suitable for attaching to Vibe report.

a5b02fb6c57524f9.name: _score_from_findings
a5b02fb6c57524f9.doc:
Conservative score model with per-severity caps.

Why: avoid "death by 1,000 lows" while still punishing criticals.

7743e054c1954c8c.name: analyze_repo
7743e054c1954c8c.signature: analyze_repo(target_path, mode, task, diff_base, run_gates, gates, policy_path, seed, min_confidence)
7743e054c1954c8c.doc:
Repo-level analysis orchestration.

This is intentionally deterministic (given the same inputs) and produces a run manifest.

d8cd1e57fb2f26ad.name: run_hook
d8cd1e57fb2f26ad.doc: Run a custom hook script if it exists in .vibe/hooks/

f1b29b5ed02e6de9.name: Claim
f1b29b5ed02e6de9.doc:
A machine-verifiable claim about an execution or decision.

The point is to prevent governance theater: any claim that implies
tool execution or verification must map to an artifact (or be E0).

3face2a38c64bb62.name: run_semgrep_sarif_gate
3face2a38c64bb62.doc:
Run semgrep and emit SARIF artifact.

- If semgrep is missing, returns allowed=False (exit_code None).
- Obeys Policy (command allowlist).

a582a3855b0bba62.name: apply_patches
a582a3855b0bba62.doc:
Apply safe patches.

Enterprise safety note:
  - Diff-aware patches are intended to be applied via `git apply` or reviewdog suggestions.
  - This method only applies full-file whitespace normalization patches.

719f6289c569b0b4.name: generate_golden_config_patches
719f6289c569b0b4.doc:
Create-only scaffolds. Never overwrite existing files.

This is intentionally conservative for enterprise repos.

e4d123fa20a3b21c.name: generate_resolve_patches
e4d123fa20a3b21c.doc:
Generate a combined patch set that addresses the highest-confidence, safest findings.

Current fixers (safe-by-default):
- whitespace normalization (existing v11 autopatch)
- n8n workflow JSON sanitizer (strip credential names/ids and replace likely secret literals)

Returns dict with {patches: List[Patch], fixed_findings: List[str], notes: Dict}

ac93eae590f8c172.name: load_yaml_text
ac93eae590f8c172.doc: Parse YAML text into a dict. Returns {} on error.

00bdaa715c3dab16.name: sanitize_n8n_text
00bdaa715c3dab16.doc: Strip credential names/ids and replace likely secret literals with placeholders.

9aa2847889e60512.name: embed_text
9aa2847889e60512.doc:
Simple hashing-vector embedding (bag-of-tokens), L2-normalized.

This is NOT an LLM embedding; it's deterministic, offline, fast, and good enough
to approximate semantic-ish retrieval across code/docs.

2d57c9893a9f7f19.name: rank
2d57c9893a9f7f19.doc: Rank (path, text) by cosine similarity to query.

ddbaa6caa1d510c6.name: search
ddbaa6caa1d510c6.doc:
Hybrid search.

mode:
  - 'fts': SQLite FTS match (keyword)
  - 'vector': hashing-vector cosine search (offline approximate semantic)
  - 'hybrid': fts + vector merged
  - 'v13': pointer + fts + vector, with rerank + grounding

ed706d94f8132360.name: _ground_file
ed706d94f8132360.doc:
Best-effort grounding for a file-level hit.

We locate the first occurrence of any query token and return a snippet with line numbers.
If no token is found, we return the file head (bounded).

a22fbdd83ddf31b1.name: _rerank
a22fbdd83ddf31b1.doc: Heuristic reranker: favors exact symbol matches and path proximity.

5342ad41245fe402.name: search
5342ad41245fe402.doc:
V13 Hybrid retrieval + rerank + grounding.

Sources:
  - Pointer registry (AdvancedSearch): symbol-aware
  - FTS: keyword
  - Vector: offline hashing embeddings

Output is grounded with (path, start_line/end_line, snippet) whenever possible.

fd63ffe480deeb61.name: build_index
fd63ffe480deeb61.doc:
Build/update an on-disk SQLite index incrementally.

Speed model:
  - Uses (mtime,size) fast-path to skip unchanged files.
  - Only decodes and writes content for changed/new files.

Stores:
  - `files`: path, mtime, size, content_hash (optional)
  - `fts`: full text (FTS5 if available)

e86641a3deeaae25.name: search_fts
e86641a3deeaae25.doc: Return list of (path, score, snippet). Score is rank-ish if FTS5, else 0.

4c0facb23ec67240.name: build
4c0facb23ec67240.doc:
Build the repo index.

This is incremental:
  - `build_index` updates only changed/new files.
  - vector indexing updates only the changed/new files (paths_updated).

fa41c4f2917e42de.name: update_github_raw
fa41c4f2917e42de.doc:
Fetch raw files from a public GitHub repo (best-effort).

repo: 'owner/name'
ref: branch/tag/sha
file_paths: list like ['README.md','skills/react-best-practices/SKILL.md']

5e25d2d513058fec.name: update_reddit_search
5e25d2d513058fec.doc: Fetch reddit search results via the public JSON endpoint (best-effort).

b0d1b931e4242721.name: run_dag
b0d1b931e4242721.doc:
Run a simple DAG spec.

Spec supports YAML/JSON with top-level `nodes` list.
Each node:
  - id: string
  - deps: [id]
  - type: 'shell'
  - cmd: ['npm','test']
  - cwd: optional relative cwd

Output is deterministic and policy-gated.

93c06d517057de42.name: generate_debate
93c06d517057de42.doc:
Generate a structured debate frame.

This runtime is intentionally deterministic/offline: it does not call an LLM.
It produces a debate script that an agent (Antigravity) can run to challenge fixes.

fb400c4f3eefdb66.name: CruelSystem
fb400c4f3eefdb66.doc:
Intelligent code debate and review engine.
Challenges every decision with evidence-based reasoning.

0dda8500e4b9a380.name: _load_knowledge_base
0dda8500e4b9a380.doc: Load comprehensive knowledge base for analysis.

e6de8169036d7548.name: _load_best_practices
e6de8169036d7548.doc: Load best practices for different languages.

9d9f0cd979e752b9.name: analyze
9d9f0cd979e752b9.doc:
Perform comprehensive 7-dimensional analysis of code.

Args:
    code: Source code to analyze
    language: Programming language
    filename: Optional filename for context
    
Returns:
    Analysis report with warnings and recommendations

c086c1b40d5e2e71.name: debate
c086c1b40d5e2e71.doc:
Debate a code decision with alternatives and trade-offs.

Args:
    decision: The decision/approach to debate
    context: Additional context about the decision
    
Returns:
    Debate analysis with alternatives and recommendations

9ea8ecd8b7b7e1b9.name: _identify_decision_type
9ea8ecd8b7b7e1b9.doc: Identify the type of decision being debated.

9b25143175d8022e.name: _aggregate_warnings
9b25143175d8022e.doc: Aggregate all warnings from all dimensions.

c8c07d2ed2f31a0b.name: _generate_debate_points
c8c07d2ed2f31a0b.doc: Generate specific debate points about the code.

9efaf860211f1c05.name: IKO
9efaf860211f1c05.doc:
Issue Knowledge Object (IKO)

Single Source of Truth for an issue:
- State machine is controlled ONLY by Gatekeeper.
- RLM/Cruel are investigators/verifiers that attach evidence & recommendations.

2bb887886fd6d864.name: EvidencePack
2bb887886fd6d864.doc:
EvidencePack

A machine-generated, CI/CD-friendly bundle of evidence for an IKO.
RLM/Cruel attach investigation results, but Gatekeeper owns state.

97af37ed45a313ba.name: collect_evidencepack
97af37ed45a313ba.doc:
Collect an EvidencePack from standard Vibe outputs.

This is meant to be used in CI/CD or canary jobs.

34f45b7353cab2e8.name: collect_run_evidencepack
34f45b7353cab2e8.signature: collect_run_evidencepack(*, repo_root, pack_id, report_path, sarif_path, baseline_path, claims_path, learning_path, gate_artifacts, ci_run_id, git_sha, out_path)
34f45b7353cab2e8.doc:
Collect a machine-verifiable EvidencePack for a single analysis/build run.

This is NOT the IKO EvidencePack (issue-centric). This pack is run-centric and is meant
to prevent governance-theater by making artifact presence + hashes mandatory.

150f0e78038e80fa.name: transition_iko
150f0e78038e80fa.signature: transition_iko(repo_root, issue_id, to_state, actor, reason, evidencepack_path)
150f0e78038e80fa.doc:
Gatekeeper-only state transition.

Rules:
- Only Gatekeeper may change IKO.state.
- EvidencePack is required for EVIDENCE_READY/APPROVED/DEPLOYING/DEPLOYED/CLOSED transitions.

28c933acc6d63ec2.name: investigate
28c933acc6d63ec2.doc:
RLM investigator: query-first, evidence-first.

NOTE: This does NOT change IKO.state. Gatekeeper is the only authority.

94155a946b9b6d2e.name: _resolve_js_import
94155a946b9b6d2e.doc: Resolve a local JS/TS import to a repo-relative file path (best-effort).

51d21b43ab19d39b.name: build_import_graph
51d21b43ab19d39b.doc:
Build a best-effort import graph for Python + JS/TS.

Uses:
  - Python AST via DependencyAnalyzer
  - JS/TS regex import parsing (fast, partial)
  - AdvancedSearch facets as a supplemental signal (imports list)

a9ba6d52ebe75000.name: impacted_by
a9ba6d52ebe75000.doc: Reverse reachability: files that may be impacted by `changed`.

864081ca956f2c1f.name: select_tests
864081ca956f2c1f.doc:
Select a focused set of tests to run based on import-graph impact.

Heuristic approach (fast, offline):
  - Build best-effort import graph
  - Compute impacted files = reverse reachability from changed files
  - Score tests by directory proximity and name affinity
  - Fallback to 'tests smoke set' if nothing matches

3c8cf56905b1f2a5.name: LearningEvent
3c8cf56905b1f2a5.doc:
Append-only run telemetry for local learning loops.

This is NOT chat memory. It's repo-local operational data to improve routing,
prioritization, and regression prevention.
